snippet: A man who was freed from prison after 20 years for a murder he did not commit was awarded $20 million in a settlement that his lawyers said is the highest individual settlement ever in a wrongful conviction case.
abstract: Juan Rivera of Illinois, who spent 20 years in prison for 1992 murder he did not commit, is awarded record-breaking $20 million settlement for a wrongful conviction.
lead_paragraph: A man who was freed from prison after 20 years for a murder he did not commit was awarded $20 million in a settlement that his lawyers said is the highest individual settlement ever in a wrongful conviction case.

headline.main: Illinois: $20 Million Settlement in False Conviction
